bio.title: Seb Hausmann, PhD
bio.subtitle: Neuroengineer & Full-Stack Developer
bio.welcome: Welcome to my portfolio! I'm a full-stack developer and Engineer from EPFL with a PhD in neuroscience. My background spans experimental research with both human subjects and mice, where I developed VR systems for behavioral studies, worked with optogenetics and neural recordings, and analyzed large-scale datasets. Now I specialize in end-to-end application development for web and iOS platforms, building complete solutions from frontend interfaces to backend infrastructure, and integrating AI workflows and automation to create intelligent, efficient systems.
bio.webApps: Full-stack web applications: TypeScript, React, Node.js, modern frameworks
bio.iosDev: iOS mobile development: React Native, Expo, Xcode
bio.aiAutomation: AI integration & automation: Implementing AI workflows, LLM integration, and process automation
bio.endToEnd: End-to-end solutions: From concept to deployment, including database design, API development, and cloud infrastructure
bio.background: This experimental neuroscience experience has fundamentally shaped how I approach software development. I bring a data-driven mindset, rigorous analytical thinking, and a deep understanding of complex system integration to every project, combining technical skills with scientific methodology.
educationItems: PhD in Neuroscience, Adaptive intelligence - EPFL, Switzerland (2025)
MSc in Neuroscience & Neuroengineering - EPFL, Switzerland (2019)
BSc in Life Sciences - EPFL, Switzerland (2017)

skills.name: AI Integration
skills.details: LLM APIs, AI-powered features, Workflow automation

items.title: VR Mouse Behavior Platform
items.description: As part of my PhD, I spearheaded the development of a virtual reality system for studying adaptive visuomotor behavior in mice using Unity3D game engine. Features markerless behavioral tracking using DeepLabCut and integration with optogenetics and neural recording systems such as neuropixels 2.0 or a mesoscope.

items.title: Digital Biomarkers Data Analysis Pipeline
items.description: As part of my PhD, I developed a python-based (DataJoint: Python wrapper for SQL) pipeline for processing and analyzing large-scale behavioral and neural data. Automatation of experimental data processing and facilitating the supervision of individual experimental sessions on a daily basis, using advanced signal processing and machine learning techniques.

items.title: Optogenetics Control System
items.description: Arduino-based system for precise control of optogenetic stimulation during behavioral experiments. Features programmable stimulation patterns.

items.title: Allen Brain Atlas Connectivity Map
items.description: As a side project, I developed a simple GUI based on PyQt to explore connectivity map based on various projection signals. Features responsive design, animations, and integration with Allen Brain Atlas' API allensdk.

items.title: Virtual Reality surrogate system for ArgusÂ® II Patients
items.description: As part of a software engineer research internship at Second Sight Medical Product, I worked on a virtual reality system for Argus II patients to help them navigate in a virtual environment. Enhancing their rehabilitation procedure. The system was developed using Unity and C#, bypassing their camera Unit. I also developed a VR simulation of what a patient sees using the Argus II system.

items.title: Is effort related to social dominance?
items.description: As part of my Master's thesis, I investigated the relationship between effort and social dominance in hierarchical groups of mice. This work was part of a larger project on the neural mechanisms of social dominance (specifically, the connections from mPFC to LH) and was conducted in laboratory of Prof. Kay M. Tye at the Salk Institute in San Diego.

items.title: Does subjective feeling of re-experiencing past events relate to memory performance?
items.description: At the Laboratory of Cognitive Neuroscience (LNCO) in Prof. Olaf Blanke's lab, together with Dr. Brechet, I investigated the relationship between the subjective feeling of re-experiencing past events and memory performance. In this project we worked with healthy human subjects and used virtual reality to manipulate the feeling of re-experiencing past events.

items.title: Building PhotoPerfectAI: Streamlining Photo Editing with Natural Language AI
items.description: An app that lets you simply talk to your photos and watch them transform. PhotoPerfectAI harnesses cutting-edge AI to make professional-grade photo editing accessible to everyone. No account required, just natural language commands that bring your vision to life.

items.title: Building EasyApplAI: Improving Job Applications with AI-Powered Automation
items.description: I created a comprehensive job application platform that transforms the tedious process of applying for jobs. Built with TypeScript and React, EasyApplAI leverages AI to craft ATS-friendly resumes and cover letters, tracks applications with a history-based system, and helps you prep for interviews, all while keeping your personal data secure through anonymization.

items.title: Building iSoundPort: My Journey Creating a Full-Stack Music Playlist Converter
items.description: How I built a web application that seamlessly converts iTunes playlists to Spotify using Flask, Firebase, and the Spotify API, with Stripe integration for payments.

items.title: Developing WizPDF: My First Mobile App for iOS and Android
items.description: The process of creating my first mobile application, a comprehensive PDF management tool for merging, modifying, and summarizing PDFs on both iOS and Android platforms.

items.title: Measuring and modeling the motor system with machine learning
items.description: A comprehensive review we wrote, exploring novel machine learning methods for understanding the motor system. Drawing parallels with artificial neural networks.
